title: "Why can't I just pick the one role I want?"
body: Are you really going to bitch after all those times when you were last pick and got forced into your absolute worst role? Fucking forbid you are guaranteed to get a role you pick. 'Nope. I want something and it is not good enough until I get it.'  It is very simple and reasonable to think the average player can handle two roles.

replies.body:
I got ADC in 73% of my games this season. They said ADC mains would expect to get their role around 50% of the time. 
 ADC is not just a role, it's the class of champions I like to play.

If you like to play tanks, you can be a support, a jungle, or a top laner. If you like to play Marksmen, you can be an ADC. That's it.
 Whenever an ADC is consistently successful in another lane (Ezreal, Graves) they get nerfed. ADCs are not solo laners. 

And it really doesn't help that I main the least role diverse champion in the game. Jinx doesn't go bot something like 0.2% of the time.

It's possible I won't see a real decrease in the amount of games I play that I enjoy, but from what they said I'm going to like playing League 20% less.

Quinn, Graves can both Jungle and top as well

Vayne can top 

Kindred is a marksman and is a jungler

Varus can Mid

Ezreal can Mid

Stop bitching and git gud

If she can go against an immobile top laner and knows how to freeze a lane, she's fine, but if not she'll get wrecked.

So that leaves Kindred and Quinn. If you don't get ahead immediately and do something, you'll probably lose the game. 60% winrate at 25 minutes, under 50% winrate after for both of them. Both of them probably need nerfs too. 

tl;dr: No, marksmen can't solo lane.

Also, do you notice how it's just a list of "This Marksmen can go in this lane, and this other one can go in this other lane"? A list that doesn't even include Jinx. Where if you wanna just play J4, you can just play j4 in whatever lane you want.

But I'll argue your points anyways

Kindred is the most banned/picked marksman in high elo/lcs right now. Quinn is strong top lane as well and in the jungle in the higher elo. Same with graves.

>A list that doesn't even include Jinx

And? You said you played a certain role, not one champ, so why is me not mentioning Jinx a problem? All of those marksmen can fit perfectly in those roles and be viable in higher elo.

Here's the problem: It's not irrelevant. Sure, knowing the stats is useful, but if some 12 year old in little League knew the frequency of Fastballs:Curveballs from a left-handed pitcher to a switch hitter, how is that going to help him in his games? 

It won't. 

This game has an entirely different dynamic from platinum and higher to gold and lower. Trash champions like Katarina can easily carry bronze games because bronze players don't understand what CCing the death lotus is. 

Back in S3 and 4, before I stopped playing again until this pre-season, I was a platinum player and I would go onto a B5 smurf every so often and do things that would NEVER fly at my level. I went Rene mid and ended up 1v5ing, and winning, because they tried baron at low HP. I went Yasuo ADC and rolled over everyone. I've gone AP Blitz mid. 

The statistics for win rates and champion:role frequencies aren't useful, more often than not, someone at Silver 4 can win with a champion they're really good with despite his stats at the plat+ level. 

It might make me sound like a dick, but bronze and silver players think that just because they know the stats, they can't go full AP Bard mid because the "pros aren't doing it." 

Tl;Dr Yes, Plat+ stats are irrelevant at the - Low gold to a degree - Silver and lower level.

People bitch about everything, honestly if you can't play at least 3 roles  outta 5 you have no business playing competitive rank it's simple as that. Go play normals till you know how to play every role then come back to ranked.

Normals is for fun and practice
Ranked if for people who should know the game well enough to play a role they get put in.


End of story

And there's something else some people miss too.

As much as the assholes try to make it seem, you do NOT have to be perfect in every role. Everyone is best somewhere and weak somewhere. The point of this is that it makes the one trick pony's have to learn a second role, which honestly can still benefit them in a way. The best way to defeat your enemy is to understand them, so having a basic knowledge on every role is more benefiting than some realize.

You don't have to be good in all the rolls, but knowing how to play other rolls will give you an understanding of when and where your teammates will be, how much farther ahead or behind you they should be, and if you should be helping them or not.

Also I agree, normals are for fun, which is why I can't think of a reason why TeamBuilder was removed.

I think the main reason, which someone had mentioned in an earlier thread, is that Riot wants a large pool of people playing on this new champ select in order to see what works and what doesn't work.  The end of teambuilder as we know it is not set in stone.

Knowing how to play two roles is not the point, the whole point of TeamBuilder is that if I wanted to play Mid, & only wanted Mid, I could be guaranteed to get that role.
If I only have time for one match in a night & I just wanted to have fun & play the role I enjoy the most, I could be guaranteed to get that role in TeamBuilder, now I'm stuck playing blind pick where I have to risk on the speed of the chat load to get the one role I want, until blind pick too is taken away, & then I'm not sure what I'll be doing, probably a lot of ARAM.

Disclaimer: I play fill and really don't give a rat's ass what I play. 

THAT SAID, I think the main issue is that if someone wanted to play X in X lane, they could go into teambuilder and 100% be able to play that champion in X lane. 

As far as I can tell, most of the arguments against this queue are not because of what it does to ranked, but because of how it is impacting normal queues.

While this is a valid response for people who played draft mode before, it means nothing for team builder players. They did get the exact role they wanted every game without fail. Now they won't. For them, this is a worse system.
The new system is much better for ranked, but it's annoying that teambuilder in normals has been taken away.

You're acting like everybody who doesn't want to play two roles is an entitled asshole. Some people like me are kind of one trick ponies or just don't enjoy other roles. I'm not going to be a bitch if I don't get my role in ranked, but I've always enjoyed team builder for being able to choose fully, even if it meant longer queue times.

Now that choice is gone, and the worst part is that when you get forced into your second role and feed, people flame you because they assume you making it your second choice means you are almost as proficient in it as your first role. 

rito pls team builder

I think the idea is that if you don't understand any other role well enough to play it you probably shouldn't be playing ranked anyway, although I do have sympathy for those who want teambuilder back for normals. Honestly, people wanted a different ranked queue system to reduce fighting and to not be forced into their worst role or have a team of 5 guys who main mid (had a game with 4 mid  mains on my team a few times, some were okay, others not so much) and the new system lets you pick your two best so you aren't stuck with your worst, seems like a fair trade to me. I do think it would be nice to have teambuilder back for normals since you usually don't care about queue time as much in normals since you won't be grinding out lp or anything like that.
